Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Esculentin-2EM (Esculentin 2EM; E2EM, Gaegurin-4, Gaegurin 4, GGN4, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)
Sequence Information.Source: skin, Korean wrinkled frogRana rugosa, Asia

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against M. luteus (MIC 2.5 ug/ml), S. epidermidis, B. subtilis (MIC 10 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. dysentariae (MIC 25 ug/ml), P. putida (MIC 100 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 100 ug/ml) and E. coli (MIC 75 ug/ml). (MIC data provided by Chunfeng Wang). It also ruptured protozoan A. proteus at 25 ug/ml in a few minutes.Toxicity:  Poor hemolysis (1.7%) at 100 ug/ml (poor Hemo.lytic).Structure:   In SDS micelles, this peptide adopts two helical regions: 2-10 and 16-32 (Park S et al. 2007) J Biochem Mol Biol 40: 261-9.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure in methanolherein the PDB.Updated 8/2008; 11/2013; 2/2014; 9/2017; 5/2020; 9/2024 formatting.
Literature Information.Author: Park JM, Jung J-E, Lee BJ.1994
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin of a Korean frog, Rana rugosa.
